title: Goldson
author: Goldson
content: Having watched this videohttps://www.bitchute.com/video/JQ3vO4upK6CXAt 20 second Mick Savel says that the Trump administration would buy up 20/25% of the Bit coin network which will then demonetized the value of BRICcoin, hence as BRICcoing is back by gold the value of gold will collapse meaning Trump will be able to wipe off the US debit.Not so long ago my bank manager sat me down in his office and said "Dont put all your eggs in one basket" meaning dont just spend all your stocks on gold. But with a great reset pending after the plandemic I could not think of any thing ells to buy at the time (and boy did I make the right decision!)But now I think well maybe now is the time to diversify that port folio after the message from Greg Reese Reports (reporter for Alex Jones Info Wars). So can anyone advice on a a cheap exchange site that will trade me my GBP in to BC for say a 2Ks worth? After all when there are online share dealing accounts like Trading212 giving free trades away on the London Stock Exchange and no subscription costs to have an account with them, then surly there must be something siular for BC (given the fact its only electrical computer running costs)

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.created_time: December 18, 2024, 09:07:48 AMLast edit: December 18, 2024, 09:19:38 AM by BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Quote from: Goldson on December 18, 2024, 12:39:35 AM So can anyone advice on a a cheap exchange site that will trade me my GBP in to BC for say a 2Ks worth? After all when there are online share dealing accounts like Trading212 giving free trades away on the London Stock Exchange and no subscription costs to have an account with them, then surly there must be something siular for BC (given the fact its only electrical computer running costs)If by BC you mean Bitcoin then you are giving the wrong abbreviations and could easily cause some confusion. Rather than saying BC you are better off saying BTC.About the exchange site you need my advice is that you should be ready to do your own research, there are a good number of exchange you can check out but don't use any of you haven't done your research. Here is a list you can check.https://koinly.io/blog/best-crypto-exchange-uk/QuoteAgreed.It's probably a typo on OP's part.Typo and it was written twice? I doubt if it was typo or OP wasn't aware and it's no bad to not know. We learn everyday and that is more important.

I read that link before thanks! and all of them where just a rip off! think i asked that question on this forum before about a cost effective exchange. well looks like there are non i guess, so guess the whole bit coin is a rip off so best forget about it all reallyUnless I can buy it on the stock market from a lagit time served and regulated body that is

comments.author: apogio
comments.body: Quote from: Goldson on December 18, 2024, 11:47:33 PMI read that link before thanks! and all of them where just a rip off! think i asked that question on this forum before about a cost effective exchange. well looks like there are non i guess, so guess the whole bit coin is a rip off so best forget about it all reallyUnless I can buy it on the stock market from a lagit time served and regulated body that isAsking a question and not getting immediate answers made you think that "the bitcoin thing" is a scam?Ok, so yes, it's much better to forget about it.And please, also forget about the forum as well.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: Quote from: Goldson on December 18, 2024, 11:47:33 PMQuote from: BIT-BENDER on December 18, 2024, 09:07:48 AMQuote from: Goldson on December 18, 2024, 12:39:35 AM So can anyone advice on a a cheap exchange site that will trade me my GBP in to BC for say a 2Ks worth? After all when there are online share dealing accounts like Trading212 giving free trades away on the London Stock Exchange and no subscription costs to have an account with them, then surly there must be something siular for BC (given the fact its only electrical computer running costs)If by BC you mean Bitcoin then you are giving the wrong abbreviations and could easily cause some confusion. Rather than saying BC you are better off saying BTC.About the exchange site you need my advice is that you should be ready to do your own research, there are a good number of exchange you can check out but don't use any of you haven't done your research. Here is a list you can check.https://koinly.io/blog/best-crypto-exchange-uk/QuoteAgreed.It's probably a typo on OP's part.Typo and it was written twice? I doubt if it was typo or OP wasn't aware and it's no bad to not know. We learn everyday and that is more important. I read that link before thanks! and all of them where just a rip off! think i asked that question on this forum before about a cost effective exchange. well looks like there are non i guess, so guess the whole bit coin is a rip off so best forget about it all reallyUnless I can buy it on the stock market from a lagit time served and regulated body that isI think you have to change your mindset then because Bitcoin is not like stock market.If you have that kind of thought then you can't buy Bitcoin. You will really need to have some technical basics, like wallet to hold your Bitcoin, that you have total control. For when to buy, it should be in crypto base exchanges.You can go check https://coinmarketcap.com/ as well regarding the price of Bitcoin and exchanges as well.

comments.author: EluguHcman
comments.body: With all being said, it is good realizing your lapses and stands out to fix them up uprightly just to meet you for the future.Realistically, investing on Bitcoin is such a store of values where the World economy does not have its effects on it such as it does in the devaluing of the fiats and the physical trades and investments.You need to understand that there is no exchange there to give you cheaper offer if not for  the traders rates per individuals and likely, you need to be careful on chasing cheap opportunities in this crypto industry or specifically how you can accumulate huge amount of Bitcoins in a cheap rate of amount invested, otherwise, you could end up into scam.Perhaps you being a beginner into this Bitcoin market would be best adviced if you can start up on investment instead of trading because trading is more technical while investment only requires primary knowledges of Bitcoins volatile movements.Maybe as time goes by you can diversify to trade. All you need now first is to breed your mind up to suit the markets system as it fluctuates not usually to users favour.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Quote from: Dave1 on December 23, 2024, 09:35:11 AMI think you have to change your mindset then because Bitcoin is not like stock market.Bitcoin is not stock. If you want to have and own bitcoin, buy bitcoin. Don't buy stocks, shares of any company with products related to Bitcoin. What you have from them is a paper, a credit number in your account, and it's not bitcoin. Whether you can claim it to bitcoin later or not, it's big uncertain future.QuoteIf you have that kind of thought then you can't buy Bitcoin. You will really need to have some technical basics, like wallet to hold your Bitcoin, that you have total control. For when to buy, it should be in crypto base exchanges.Choose a good wallet to use with 2 biggest criteria: non custodial, and open source.https://bitcoin.org/en/choose-your-wallethttps://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/recommended-wallets.htmlhttps://learnmeabitcoin.com/beginners/wallets/How to back up a wallet seed phrase?

comments.author: fikrett
comments.body: Quote from: Dave1 on December 23, 2024, 09:35:11 AMI think you have to change your mindset then because Bitcoin is not like stock market.If you have that kind of thought then you can't buy Bitcoin. You will really need to have some technical basics, like wallet to hold your Bitcoin, that you have total control. For when to buy, it should be in crypto base exchanges.You can go check https://coinmarketcap.com/ as well regarding the price of Bitcoin and exchanges as well.OP's keys - OP's coins. Invest your time properly in the things Dave1 told you, Goldson, and your time in the space would be a bit better and safer.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Goldson on December 18, 2024, 11:47:33 PMI read that link before thanks! and all of them where just a rip off! think i asked that question on this forum before about a cost effective exchange. well looks like there are non i guess, so guess the whole bit coin is a rip off so best forget about it all reallyMay be best to forget about it if you conclude it to be a rip off with so little information. You'll likely be willing to bail and sell out without doing much research, so best to stick to the market you are already familiar with.

comments.author: Zoomic
comments.body: Quote from: Goldson on December 18, 2024, 11:47:33 PMI read that link before thanks! and all of them where just a rip off! think i asked that question on this forum before about a cost effective exchange. well looks like there are non i guess, so guess the whole bit coin is a rip off so best forget about it all reallyUnless I can buy it on the stock market from a lagit time served and regulated body that isI see now, you are going to invest in bitcoin because bitcoin's price is increasing ,but deep down in your heart you don't really believe in bitcoin. Maybe you should stick to gold and other assets that you believe in because with this mindset you have about bitcoin, it is very obvious that you are not ready to invest in bitcoin. You ain't doing us any favour by investing, investing in bitcoin is not risks free, bear this in mind so when you eventually invest, you would be fully prepared.

comments.author: Oluwa-btc
comments.body: Quote from: Goldson on December 18, 2024, 11:47:33 PMQuote from: BIT-BENDER on December 18, 2024, 09:07:48 AMQuote from: Goldson on December 18, 2024, 12:39:35 AM So can anyone advice on a a cheap exchange site that will trade me my GBP in to BC for say a 2Ks worth? After all when there are online share dealing accounts like Trading212 giving free trades away on the London Stock Exchange and no subscription costs to have an account with them, then surly there must be something siular for BC (given the fact its only electrical computer running costs)You're yet to know and learn a lot about Bitcoin and you wouldn't be able to learn one or two with an angry attitude and attention.I've realized that it takes time to fix your interests in Bitcoin,and the forum has no hand in your displeasure to research and make detailed observations.Mind you, learning Bitcoin in the forum is relatively cheap and the easiest form for adapting with captivating ideas and contributions.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: Goldson on December 18, 2024, 12:39:35 AMHaving watched this videohttps://www.bitchute.com/video/JQ3vO4upK6CXAt 20 second Mick Savel says that the Trump administration would buy up 20/25% of the Bit coin network which will then demonetized the value of BRICcoin, hence as BRICcoing is back by gold the value of gold will collapse meaning Trump will be able to wipe off the US debit.Stop believing in all these, not all of them will appear to be the same way they have said it, the power to make influence is more effective o centralized assets, we have lots to talk about when it comes to BRICS and for now we may put them aside, Trump administration is not yet fully in power until after January before we can know what they are up to, lastly, regarding gold, the value is hitting all time high does not interpret to us that BRICScoin being backed by gold will eventually lead to the fall, things will always work for each season as found in it, whether we use it or not.
